page.title: 14WILDLIFE IN FINZEAN WOODS.
page.content: The dominant habitat is coniferous plantations.The majority are even aged stands,planted since 1950.The older plantations are Scots Pine,the more recent of{Sitka and Norway Spruces. } In the West,toward Corybeg,there are {old pines and}recent natural regeneration of native origin.This is an area of{high conservation value.Ant {heaps}occur only here and it is the best area for{Blackgrouse,Capercaillie {and Scottish Crossbills.}There are {Wildcats}but no contemporary records of Pine Marten.{Red deer}are increasing (30+ stags). {Roe}have increased throughout the plantations and{Red squirrels}are widespread.{Birch}is the only common native broadleaved tree,self-sown within and between the plantings,its only management exploitive felling.
